author: nathanlopes
title: PF diz que esquema que teria desviado R$ 36 milhÃµes do Pros contava com familiares prÃ³ximos de EurÃ­pides JÃºnior
text:
PF diz que esquema que teria desviado R$ 36 milhÃµes do Pros contava com familiares prÃ³ximos de EurÃ­pides JÃºnior
Esposa, filhas, mÃ£e, irmÃ£o e primo do presidente do Solidariedade, considerado foragido, eram divididos em NÃºcleos para coordenar a operaÃ§Ã£o
Segundo decisÃ£o da JustiÃ§a que autorizou a
aÃ§Ã£o contra o presidente do Solidariedade, EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior, e seus familiares, a suposta operaÃ§Ã£o criminosa que desviou R$ 36 milhÃµes do caixa do partido era dividida em nÃºcleos.
Os grupos, afirma a PolÃ­cia Federal (PF), tinham entre seus integrantes familiares prÃ³ximos de
EurÃ­pides, que Ã© acusado de liderar o esquema e considerado foragido.
Conforme consta no documento â€” ao qual a CNN teve acesso â€“, a PF apontou que a autoria dos crimes seria dividida em quatro nÃºcleos:
- NÃºcleo Central (NÃºcleo Duro)
- NÃºcleo de pessoas interpostas (Laranjas)
- NÃºcleo Advogados
- NÃºcleo de candidaturas laranjas no Distrito Federal.
Ainda de acordo com a decisÃ£o que atendeu o pedido de busca e apreensÃ£o da PF, os investigadores identificaram os seguintes familiares de EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior como integrantes da organizaÃ§Ã£o criminosa:
- Esposa: Ariele de Oliveira Coimbra Macedo, investigada no NÃºcleo de Laranjas.
- Filha: Jheniffer Hannah Lima de Macedo, investigada no NÃºcleo Central.
- Filha: Giovanna Yule Lima de Macedo, investigada no NÃºcleo de Laranjas.
- MÃ£e: Maria Aparecida dos Santos, investigada no NÃºcleo de Laranjas.
- IrmÃ£o: FabrÃ­cio George Gomes dos Santos, investigado no NÃºcleo Central.
- Primo: Alessandro Sousa da Silva, investigado no NÃºcleo Central.
Na Ãºltima quarta-feira (12), a PF cumpriu mandados de prisÃ£o e busca e apreensÃ£o contra EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior, seus familiares, uma ex-secretÃ¡ria do Partido Republicano da Ordem Social (Pros) e dois advogados. EurÃ­pedes nÃ£o foi encontrado e Ã©
considerado foragido.
A PF conseguiu apreender um
helicÃ³ptero avaliado em R$ 5 milhÃµes. Segundo a investigaÃ§Ã£o, a aeronave foi comprada com dinheiro pÃºblico do fundo eleitoral e estava na casa do EurÃ­pedes.
A JustiÃ§a tambÃ©m autorizou pedido para bloqueio de bens no valor de R$ 36 milhÃµes, entre 32 imÃ³veis e 10 carros.
Em nota, o Solidariedade informou que os fatos investigados sÃ£o anteriores Ã  fusÃ£o do partido com o Pros, legenda que foi incorporada ao Solidariedade no ano passado. A defesa de EurÃ­pedes nÃ£o foi encontrada.
Parque GrÃ¡fico do Pros
No documento, tambÃ©m foi apontado que hÃ¡ quatro dias para o julgamento que destituiu EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior do DiretÃ³rio Nacional do Pros, a PF identificou a retirada de todos os equipamentos que faziam parte do parque grÃ¡fico do partido em Planaltina de GoiÃ¡s, no entorno de BrasÃ­lia.
A investigaÃ§Ã£o identificou que foi o prÃ³prio EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior que determinou a retirada. A PF reuniu imagens realizadas no local e notÃ­cias da Ã©poca que mostram caminhÃµes retirando o maquinÃ¡rio que pertencia ao partido. Segundo o relatÃ³rio, as despesas para a retirada dos equipamentos custaram 170 mil reais e foram pagas com o fundo partidÃ¡rio.
A venda dos equipamentos teria rendido aos cofres do partido pouco mais de 400 mil reais. PorÃ©m, o valor de nota fiscal da venda Ã© de mais que o dobro do valor que foi para conta do partido, R$ 868.531,33. Para piorar, a investigaÃ§Ã£o identificou que a avaliaÃ§Ã£o dos equipamentos era de mais de 15 milhÃµes de dÃ³lares. A PF acredita que o desvio desses valores teria abastecido o grupo investigado.
AlÃ©m do maquinÃ¡rio, a PF informou que foram retirados da sede do Partido, em BrasÃ­lia, um helicÃ³ptero, dez carros, aparelhos de ar-condicionado, computadores, mÃ³veis e atÃ© o sistema de energia solar. Tudo pertencente ao Partido e adquirido com dinheiro pÃºblico.
Outro lado
A CNN tenta contato com EurÃ­pedes JÃºnior e as defesas de Ariele de Oliveira Coimbra Macedo, Jheniffer Hannah Lima de Macedo, Giovanna Yule Lima de Macedo, Maria Aparecida dos Santos, FabrÃ­cio George Gomes dos Santos e Alessandro Sousa da Silva. O espaÃ§o segue aberto.
Em nota, o
Solidariedade disse que â€œsÃ£o fatos ocorridos antes da uniÃ£o do Pros com o Solidariedadeâ€. â€œEstamos tomando pÃ© da situaÃ§Ã£o e ainda nÃ£o temos uma posiÃ§Ã£o sobre os fatosâ€, disse o partido.

author: Khalil Maycock
title: 'The family demands answers': Attorney says inmate is on ventilator after 'incident' involving JSO jail officers
text:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. â€“ The attorney for the family of an inmate who was critically injured in an unspecified incident involving nine Duval County jail officers said on Wednesday that the man remains hospitalized and on a ventilator.
In a statement to News4JAX, Attorney Belkis Plata identified the injured inmate as Charles Faggart.
Recommended Videos
On Tuesday, Sheriff T.K. Waters announced that eight correctional officers and a correctional sergeant were removed from their positions and stripped of all their correction authority following the incident, which happened on Monday morning.
Plataâ€™s statement to News4JAX reads in part:
â€œThe family is devastated and demands answers regarding how Charles sustained such catastrophic injuries while in the custody and under the supervision of the Jacksonville Sheriffâ€™s Office â€” a place where he should have been kept safe...â€
Waters said he would not give details about the incident or how the inmate was injured because it was still an open investigation.
With Tuesdayâ€™s news conference leaving many unanswered questions, News4JAX reached out to JSO on Wednesday, asking:
What led to Faggart being critically injured? Was he assaulted? Was it a medical issue? When youâ€™re able, can you release the names of the officers involved? Did cameras catch what happened? However, JSO did not answer our inquiry due to the ongoing investigation.
News4JAX Crime and Safety Analyst Tom Hackney said it is concerning to know so many corrections staff were removed from their position following this incident, and added that investigators have a lot to look into.
â€œThereâ€™s two different ways this investigation is going to go: one is a criminal investigation into any potential uses of force,â€ Hackney said. â€œIf thatâ€™s the case, the state attorney will step in and investigate, and then an internal investigation happens.â€
Hackney said that the investigation could take a long time.
Faggartâ€™s attorney also told News4JAX that the incident placed an â€œoverwhelming emotional and financial burden on the family.â€
â€œMr. Faggart is a father to a six-year-old son, Lincoln, who now faces the likelihood of growing up without a dad. The family has established a GoFundMe page to assist with mounting medical expenses and to provide support for Lincoln during this extremely difficult time,â€ Plata wrote.
Inmate records show Faggart was arrested for domestic assault and criminal mischief.
Copyright 2025 by WJXT News4JAX - All rights reserved.

author: Jennifer Ludden
title: As heat waves intensify, more public housing residents may get help with AC bills | WYPR
text: As heat waves intensify, more public housing residents may get help with AC bills The summer has already been a scorcher and heat alerts across the country could lead to more records broken. Public housing residents, many elderly, children or sick, are [disproportionately vulnerable](https://www.npr.org/2023/08/01/1190885287/extreme-heat-public-housing-air-conditioning-hud) to heat illness, yet thereâ€™s no federal mandate to provide them air conditioning. In fact, until last month the Department of Housing and Urban Development allowed local housing agencies to subsidize tenantsâ€™ heating bills, but â€” with some exceptions â€” explicitly said they could not pay for cooling bills. New [guidance](https://www.hud.gov/press/press_releases_media_advisories/hud_no_24_145) changes that, though critics say it still [falls short](https://www.npr.org/2024/06/27/nx-s1-5021537/public-housing-buildings-can-now-pay-for-residents-acs-providing-relief-to-many). â€œWe must protect the health and safety of our families during increasingly severe weather events, like extreme heat, that can cause grave harm and even death to any member of our community,â€ said HUD Acting Secretary Adrianne Todman in a [statement](https://www.hud.gov/press/press_releases_media_advisories/hud_no_24_145) announcing the change last month. Several public housing residents were among the hundreds who died when a [heat wave struck](https://www.npr.org/2022/07/27/1114075017/heat-wave-lessons-learned-in-pacific-northwest) the Pacific Northwest in 2021. Last year, Portland public housing resident Beth Vansmith [told NPR](https://www.npr.org/2023/08/01/1190885287/extreme-heat-public-housing-air-conditioning-hud) she remembers how awful she felt at that time, with no air conditioner and temperatures soaring up to 116. "I would get dizzy. I would get nauseous. You know, I'd lose my appetite completely, and it was just so miserably hot," she said. Much public housing was built before central air was common, and at a time when it was not necessary in many parts of the country. Yet even as [climate-fueled heat waves](https://www.npr.org/2024/06/10/nx-s1-4842299/climate-disasters-death-tolls) grow more intense and frequent, public housing residents who want an AC unit must buy it themselves. And some who do often hesitate to use it because of the added cost to their electric bill. Now, local housing agencies will be allowed to subsidize cooling costs during a severe heat period. HUD has spelled out its own definition of that: two to three days of intense heat and humidity, with temperatures reaching at least 90 degrees. But local agencies can decide on their own definition of what will trigger cooling subsidies. â€œWe are providing maximum local control and decision-making for an issue that impacts more and more communities across the country each year,â€ said Richard Monocchio, with HUDâ€™s Office of Public and Indian Housing. Still, the change comes with other caveats that critics say could limit its impact. Paying for cooling costs is not required, and tenants must ask for the help â€œThis is a very small step,â€ says Daniel Carpenter-Gold, a staff attorney with the Public Health Law Center in St. Paul, Minn. â€œIt doesn't do anything if the resident doesn't have air conditioning or some other form of cooling.â€ For those who do have their own AC, Carpenter-Gold says thereâ€™s still no mandate to subsidize cooling costs. Local agencies will simply have the option to do that. And â€” crucially â€” the burden is on a tenant to ask for the help. Carpenter-Gold says a public housing agency is functionally a landlord, inherently a tricky relationship, and that could make this a hard ask for some people. Whatâ€™s more, he says itâ€™s not clear how the message of this new option will be put out to people. â€œThey might not get the notice in the first place that this is a thing,â€ he says. â€œAnd the residents might not apply in time for them to actually feel like they can turn on their AC â€¦ when the heat strikes.â€ Even agencies eager to help will need to come up with a whole new system to approve and organize payments, he says, but many of them are cash-strapped and understaffed. In 2022, the Public Health Law Center and other groups [petitioned](https://www.publichealthlawcenter.org/sites/default/files/resources/public-housing-petition.pdf) HUD to subsidize cooling costs for all tenants, just as it does for heating. Carpenter-Gold says HUD could make that change on its own, but it would be a long, bureaucratic process to get done. In the meantime, a growing number of local housing agencies have scrambled to find [funding](https://www.houstonpublicmedia.org/articles/infrastructure/2023/08/08/459053/public-housing-will-receive-air-conditioning-from-houston-housing-authoritys-heat-relief-initiative/) on their own to [provide](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/environment/climate-change/article280348599.html) air-conditioning for tenants. And some are tapping into funding for clean energy retrofits that President [Biden pushed Congress](https://www.npr.org/2022/07/29/1114216967/climate-experts-experience-an-odd-sensation-after-the-manchin-budget-deal-optimi) to pass. HUD is encouraging agencies to switch to solar or heat pumps, which can reduce not only carbon emissions but also tenantsâ€™ bills. And its new heat guide also touts painting roofs and sidewalks white and constructing shady areas around buildings. Those things can help bring down overall temperatures, even if residents donâ€™t have AC in their apartments. Copyright 2024 NPR

organizations.name: department of housing and urban development

author: Palden Nyima and Daqiong
title: Wildlife rangers save rare white Tibetan antelope calf - Asia News NetworkAsia News Network
text:
LHASA â€“ Wildlife rangers on patrol in the remote Changtang National Nature Reserve, in Southwest Chinaâ€™s Xizang autonomous region, recently stumbled upon the first white Tibetan antelope calf ever found in the reserve.
High in the Himalayas, at nearly 5,000 meters above sea level, Tibetan antelope, along with their newborn calves, face a gauntlet of predators such as wolves and bears during their annual migration to their summer habitat. Staff at the Tsolungma Management Station play a vital role, conducting daily patrols, monitoring movements and setting up warning signs to protect the animals.
During a recent patrol, rangers found the shivering white calf by a river. They swiftly rescued the tiny creature, wrapped it in warm clothes and took it back to the station for care.
â€œWhite animals are considered auspicious symbols in Tibetan culture,â€ said Lodre, chief of the station, who led the rescue. â€œFinding a white antelope calf is an incredibly rare sight.â€
Station staff members are now bottle-feeding the white calf, along with several other calves separated from their mothers during the migration. The seven rangers have saved 20 young antelope this year.
â€œAfter a few months of care, these calves will be strong enough to return to the wild,â€ Lodre said.
According to the regionâ€™s 2023 Environmental Bulletin, Tibetan antelope numbers have boomed from a low of 70,000 last century to over 300,000 today. Similar gains have been seen in black-necked crane populations, which have grown from under 2,000 to over 10,000.
Officials credit strict ecological protection measures for the positive trend. Improved water quality and a focus on biodiversity conservation have led to a significant recovery in wildlife populations, with species never before seen in the region also being discovered.
â€œCamera traps have captured elusive Bengal tigers in the wild,â€ said Tsering Gyatso, deputy head of Xizangâ€™s Regional Ecology and Environment Department. â€œWeâ€™ve even had sightings of the black stork, a rare bird known as the â€˜giant panda of birdsâ€™.â€
Xizang has 47 nature reserves, which cover over a third of its land area.

author: Vatican News
title: Corpus Christi: FranÃ§ois appelle Ã  rendre grÃ¢ce en Ã©tant proche des autres
text:
Corpus Christi: FranÃ§ois appelle Ã  rendre grÃ¢ce en Ã©tant proche des autres
Vatican news
Cela faisait six ans que la basilique Saint-Jean-de-Latran nâ€™avait pas accueilli la cÃ©lÃ©bration de la solennitÃ© du Saint-Sacrement en son sein. Dans son homÃ©lie, le Saint-PÃ¨re a invitÃ© les fidÃ¨les Ã  partir de la bÃ©nÃ©diction du pain par JÃ©sus (Â«Ayant pris du pain et prononcÃ© la bÃ©nÃ©dictionÂ» (Mc 14, 22)), afin de rÃ©flÃ©chir aux trois dimensions suivantes: Â«lâ€™action de grÃ¢ce, la mÃ©moire et la prÃ©senceÂ».
Lâ€™action de grÃ¢ce
Se penchant en premier lieu sur Â«lâ€™action de grÃ¢ceÂ», le Saint-PÃ¨re a rappelÃ© la signification du mot Â«EucharistieÂ»: Â«remercier Dieu pour ses donsÂ». Câ€™est pourquoi le signe du pain est important, a soulignÃ© le Pape, car Â«câ€™est la nourriture de tous les jours, par laquelle nous apportons Ã  lâ€™autel tout ce que nous sommes et ce que nous avons: la vie, les Å“uvres, les succÃ¨s, et mÃªme les Ã©checsÂ». Â«Lâ€™Eucharistie nous apprend donc Ã  bÃ©nir, Ã  accueillir et Ã  embrasser, toujours, en action de grÃ¢ce, les dons de Dieu, et cela non seulement dans la cÃ©lÃ©bration, mais aussi dans la vieÂ» a poursuivi FranÃ§ois.
Pour se faire, lâ€™Ã©vÃªque de Rome a exhortÃ© les fidÃ¨les Ã  ne pas gaspiller les choses et les talents que le Seigneur leur a donnÃ©s, mais aussi a pardonnÃ© ceux qui se trompent et qui tombent, Â«par faiblesse ou par erreurÂ». Accomplir son travail Â«avec amour, avec prÃ©cision, avec soinÂ» est Ã©galement une action de grÃ¢ce selon le Saint-PÃ¨re. Â«Ce sont des attitudes â€œeucharistiquesâ€ importantes, parce quâ€™elles nous apprennent Ã  saisir la valeur de ce que nous faisons et de ce que nous offronsÂ» a dÃ©clarÃ© le Souverain pontife.
Faire mÃ©moire de PÃ¢ques dans le pain rompu de lâ€™Eucharistie
Dans un deuxiÃ¨me temps, le Pape sâ€™est intÃ©ressÃ© Ã  la bÃ©nÃ©diction du pain, qui signifie Â«faire mÃ©moireÂ». Ã€ lâ€™Ã©poque de lâ€™ancien IsraÃ«l Â«il sâ€™agissait de se souvenir de la libÃ©ration de lâ€™esclavage en Ã‰gypte et du dÃ©but de lâ€™exode vers la Terre promiseÂ» a expliquÃ© le Pape, avant dâ€™ajouter quâ€™il sâ€™agit aujourdâ€™hui de Â«revivre la PÃ¢que du Christ, sa Passion et sa RÃ©surrection, par lesquelles il nous a libÃ©rÃ©s du pÃ©chÃ© et de la mortÂ». Le Saint-PÃ¨re a appelÃ© Ã  Â«faire mÃ©moire de notre vie, de nos succÃ¨s, de nos erreursÂ» et surtout Ã  Â«faire mÃ©moire de cette main tendue du Seigneur qui nous aide toujours Ã  nous releverÂ».
La libertÃ© ne signifie cependant pas faire tout ce que lâ€™on veut Â«au mÃ©pris des autresÂ», et elle ne se trouve pas Â«dans les coffres-forts de ceux qui accumulent pour eux-mÃªmes, ni sur les divans de ceux qui se complaisent avec paresse dans le dÃ©sengagement et lâ€™individualismeÂ». Â«La libertÃ© se trouve dans le cÃ©nacle oÃ¹, sans autre motif que lâ€™amour, on se penche devant les frÃ¨res et sÅ“urs pour leur offrir son service, sa vie, comme des â€œsauvÃ©s"Â» a soulignÃ© FranÃ§ois.
Se rendre proche des autres
Enfin, le pain eucharistique reprÃ©sente la prÃ©sence rÃ©elle du Christ, Â«un Dieu qui nâ€™est pas distant et jaloux, mais proche et solidaire de lâ€™homme; qui ne nous abandonne pas, mais qui nous cherche, qui nous attend et qui nous accompagne, toujours jusquâ€™Ã  se mettre, sans dÃ©fense, entre nos mainsÂ». Câ€™est cette prÃ©sence, a expliquÃ© FranÃ§ois, qui invite les fidÃ¨les Ã  Ãªtre eux aussi proches des leurs frÃ¨res et sÅ“urs.
Â«Et combien notre monde a besoin de ce pain, de son parfum et de sa senteur, qui dÃ©gagent la gratitude, la libertÃ© et la proximitÃ©!Â» sâ€™est exclamÃ© FranÃ§ois. Â«Chaque jour, nous voyons trop de rues (â€¦) Ãªtre rÃ©duites Ã  des tas de dÃ©combres Ã  cause de la guerre, de lâ€™Ã©goÃ¯sme et de lâ€™indiffÃ©rence ! Il est urgent de rendre au monde la bonne et fraÃ®che odeur du pain de lâ€™amour, de continuer Ã  espÃ©rer et Ã  reconstruire sans jamais se lasser de ce que la haine dÃ©truitÂ» a conseillÃ© le Souverain pontife.
Ã€ lâ€™issue de la messe, la procession se dirigera vers la basilique Sainte-Marie-Majeure, dâ€™oÃ¹ sera donnÃ©e la bÃ©nÃ©diction eucharistique. Â«Nous ne faisons pas cela pour nous exhiber, ni mÃªme pour faire Ã©talage de notre foi, a prÃ©cisÃ© FranÃ§ois, mais pour inviter tout le monde Ã  participer, dans le Pain de lâ€™Eucharistie, Ã  la vie nouvelle que JÃ©sus nous a donnÃ©e: c'est dans cet esprit que nous faisons la processionÂ».
Merci d'avoir lu cet article. Si vous souhaitez rester informÃ©, inscrivez-vous Ã  la lettre dâ€™information en
[ cliquant ici](/fr/inscription-newsletter.html)

author: @andaluciainf
title: AbÃ¡s pide el fin del "rÃ­o de sangre" del pueblo palestino en su mensaje de Navidad | AndalucÃ­a InformaciÃ³n. Todas las noticias de AlmerÃ­a
text: El presidente palestino, Mahmud AbÃ¡s, pidiÃ³ hoy el fin del "rio de sangre" y de los "inmensos sacrificios" del pueblo palestino en un mensaje de felicitaciÃ³n de Navidad, celebraciÃ³n que cobra especial relevancia en BelÃ©n, donde la tradiciÃ³n cristiana ubica el nacimiento de JesÃºs. "El rÃ­o de sangre, los inmensos sacrificios, las penurias y la heroica resiliencia de nuestro pueblo en su tierra son el camino hacia la libertad y la dignidad", afirmÃ³ el presidente de la Autoridad Palestina, que gobierna zonas reducidas de Cisjordania ocupada. Cada 24 de diciembre, BelÃ©n -centro de la comunidad cristiana palestina- celebra un tradicional desfile con bandas de mÃºsica, previo a la llegada del Patriarca Latino de JerusalÃ©n a pie para oficiar una misa en la Iglesia de Santa Catalina, la parte catÃ³lica basÃ­lica de la Natividad. Pero este aÃ±o, el patriarca Pierbattista Pizzaballa -el enviado religioso del Vaticano a Tierra Santa- llegarÃ¡ a BelÃ©n en una procesiÃ³n solemne, sin mÃºsica ni actos festivos, de luto por el alto nÃºmero de muertos palestinos en la guerra en la Franja de Gaza, que superan los 20.200 mientras prosigue la ofensiva israelÃ­. Cisjordania ocupada tambiÃ©n ha vivido su aÃ±o mÃ¡s mortÃ­fero desde 2002, el pico de violencia de la Segunda Intifada, con unos 510 muertos, mÃ¡s de la mitad desde el 7 de octubre, cuando comenzÃ³ la guerra en el enclave. AbÃ¡s expresÃ³ hoy, dÃ­a de Nohebuena, su esperanza de que esta Navidad marque el cese de la guerra israelÃ­ contra el pueblo palestino en Gaza y el resto de territorios palestinos ocupados, deseando "prosperidad y estabilidad para el pueblo palestino y todas las naciones". "El sol de la libertad y [nuestro] Estado independiente con JerusalÃ©n como capital estÃ¡ inevitablemente surgiendo, casi a nuestro alcance", afirmÃ³ el presidente en su discurso de Navidad. "El pueblo palestino estÃ¡ decidido a continuar su lucha para lograr sus derechos legÃ­timos, el principal de los cuales es el derecho a un Estado independiente y plenamente soberano, donde puedan vivir con dignidad en su patria", agregÃ³. El presidente palestino tambiÃ©n rindiÃ³ homenaje a los miles de "mÃ¡rtires de Palestina", deseÃ³ una pronta recuperaciÃ³n para los heridos, libertad para los prisioneros y orÃ³ por la preservaciÃ³n del pueblo palestino en Gaza, Cisjordania, JerusalÃ©n y la diÃ¡spora. EnvÃ­a tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Tobias Utz
title: Android-Smartphones: Samsung enttÃ¤uscht im Ranking
text:
Android-Smartphones: Samsung enttÃ¤uscht im Ranking
Samsung fÃ¤llt im Leistungsvergleich der Smartphones im Juli zurÃ¼ck: Die Analysen einer Plattform offenbaren deutlich leistungsfÃ¤higere Konkurrenten.
Frankfurt/Peking â€“ Im aktuellsten Leistungsvergleich der schnellsten Android-Smartphones schneidet Samsung nicht gut ab. Ein Gaming-Handy fÃ¼hrt die Rangliste der Plattform AnTuTu hingegen an. Das geht aus Juli-Daten des Anbieters, der den chinesischen Markt monatlich analysiert, hervor. Dabei fokussiert dieser sich auf Smartphones mit dem Betriebssystem Android.
Wie eingangs erwÃ¤hnt sicherte sich das Red Magic 10S Pro+, ein Smartphone, das laut chip.de in Gamingkreisen beliebt ist, den ersten Platz im AnTuTu-Ranking in China.
